thread.title: Alabama opens as double-figure favorite to beat Tennessee
thread.title_full: Alabama opens as double-figure favorite to beat Tennessee

author: Michael Casagrande | mcasagrande@al.com
title: Alabama opens as double-figure favorite to beat Tennessee
text:
Comments 
Alabama's winning streak in the Tennessee rivalry will get its annual test at 2:30 p.m. CT Saturday in Bryant-Denny Stadium. 
Odds makers don't see much of a challenge for the run to extend past the current eight-straight wins. Alabama opened as a 14 Â½-point favorite to beat Tennessee, according to VegasInsiders.com . 
The No. 8 Tide (6-1, 3-1 SEC) has not lost to the Vols since 2006, Mike Shula's last year as head coach. Alabama's dominated as the 12-10 win in 2009 was the only one-score victory margin of the streak. The Tide won 34-20 last October in Knoxville. 
Tennessee (3-3) was the preseason sleeper pick in the SEC East, grabbing a No. 25 ranking in August. Losses in three of four games from Sept. 12-Oct. 3 saw the Vols blow leads against Oklahoma, Florida and Arkansas. 
Before taking a bye on Saturday, Tennessee came from behind to beat Georgia 38-31 on Oct. 10. 
Alabama has won four straight since falling to Ole Miss last month. That run includes two road wins (Georgia, Texas A&M) at teams ranked in the top-10 at the time.
